alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 09 at 3:59PM AKST until December 11 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SUNDAY TO 5 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions and heavy snow expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile at times. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with local amounts up to 18 inches possible. Highest snow amounts over interior Bristol Bay, including Koliganek and New Stuyahok. Northerly winds gusting 30 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay. * WHEN...From 3 AM Sunday to 5 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Blowing snow and heavy snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will develop first along the Alaska Peninsula late tonight then spread north and west across the remainder of the Bristol Bay area Sunday morning. There is some uncertainty on where the worst conditions will set up, but right now it looks to be from around King Salmon northward to New Stuyahok and other inland communities. Dillingham will be somewhere near the western periphery of the heaviest snow, so confidence is low on whether they will see the worst conditions with this storm.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
